Hi Chris,

I'm assuming you're using SharpNEAT 2, correct?

The CreateGenom=
eList method has an overload which takes a seed genome.
Genomes are stored =
to disk as XML files which you can create/edit by hand if
you want. You can=
 load a fixed-topology genome from file (see
NeatGenomeXmlIO) and then pass=
 it to that method as a seed. Then just change
the reference in your INeatE=
xperiment implementation to use your new
CreateEvolutionAlgorithm.

You'll =
also want to edit your NeatGenomeParameters to set
AddNodeMutationProbabili=
ty, AddConnectionMutationProbability,
DeleteConnectionMutationProbability, =
and
DeleteSimpleNeuronMutationProbability equal to 0.

If you're using Shar=
pNEAT v1, I'd recommend switching to version 2. It's a
lot more elegantly d=
esigned and offers more room for customization and
extensibility.

SharpNEA=
T 2: https://sites.google.com/site/sharpneat/
Code is available at the bott=
om.

I wrote a couple tutorials on SN2 as well:

http://www.nashcoding.com/=
2010/07/17/tutorial-evolving-neural-networks-with-sharpneat-2-part-1/
http:=
//www.nashcoding.com/2010/07/24/tutorial-%e2%80%93-evolving-neural-networks=
-with-sharpneat-2-part-2/

Hope that helps!

Wesley


On Fri, Oct 29, 2010 =
at 1:22 AM, chris2005hi <chrismnu2003@...> wrote:

f this is a silly question, I just started experimenting with
> NEAT. Is th=
ere a way to for SharpNEAT to start with and evolve only standard
> feed-fo=
rward, single-layer perceptron networks?
>
>  
>

--20cf303638b5a8cc720493baf955
